sections.story_beat: Mirror their current state â€” expertise-rich, audience-poor, posting into the void
sections.content:
You know your craft. You've got proof. You deliver results.

But your content? 12 likes. 3 comments. Mostly bots.

You post 3-5 times a week. It takes hours. You're exhausted. And the people who NEED what you offer have no idea you exist.

Here's why: **Everyone sounds the same.** Generic advice. Motivational fluff. Copy-paste frameworks with zero edge.

You're not being seen because you're not different. And you're burning out trying to be everywhere at once.

**I fixed this in 12 months.** 0 â†’ 110K followers. Zero ads. Zero cold outreach. Just systems.

The playbook you're reading is the result. 8 prompts. 7 days. Three layers that stack: positioning, content, distribution.

Let's build.
sections.callout_text: ðŸ’¡ **The Core Issue:** You're competing on value when you should be competing on positioning. No one can out-value you. They can out-position you.
sections.takeaway: The problem isn't your expertise. It's that no one knows you exist â€” and when they find you, you sound like everyone else.

sections.title: ðŸ” Layer 1: Positioning (Because Nothing Works Without This)
sections.story_beat: Start the journey â€” positioning first. You can't build an audience if you sound like everyone else.
sections.content:
Before you create a single post, you need to own a space. Not compete in one. Own one.

Most people skip this. They post about "productivity" or "marketing" or "AI" â€” and wonder why no one cares. You're competing with millions.

**The fix:** Find the intersection of your skills that NO ONE else has. That's your unfair advantage.

---

### **Prompt 1: The Unfair Advantage Finder**

```
I want to build authority in [your industry]. Here's my background:
- Professional experience: [list 3-5 roles/companies]
- Skills: [list 3-5 core skills]
- Wins: [list 2-3 measurable results]
- Audience I serve: [describe ideal client]

Analyze my experience and identify 3 unique positioning angles that combine my background in ways most people can't replicate. For each: what makes it unique, who it appeals to, content themes. Format as a table.
```

**What it unlocks:** You stop competing with millions. You own a space of hundreds.

---

### **Prompt 2: The One-Liner Generator**

```
My positioning: [paste from Prompt 1]
My proof: [2-3 measurable results]
My offer: [what you're driving traffic to]

Write 5 one-liner bios:
"I help [audience] achieve [outcome] using [method] â€” [proof]."

Punchy. Specific. Credible. No fluff.
```

**What it unlocks:** Someone reads your bio and instantly knows if you're for them. Clarity = conversion.

---

**Why this comes first:** If you're not positioned, your content is just noise. Once you're positioned, everything you create reinforces your authority.
sections.callout_text: âš ï¸ **The Mistake:** Skipping positioning and jumping straight to content. You'll create 100 posts that say nothing.
sections.takeaway: Positioning is the foundation. Get this right and everything compounds. Skip it and you're just adding to the noise.

sections.title: âš¡ Layer 2: Content Engine (Scale Without Burnout)
sections.story_beat: Now that you know WHAT to say, here's how to say it at scale. Each format builds on your positioning.
sections.content:
You know your angle. Now you need volume.

But here's the trap: most people try to scale by working MORE. 5 posts becomes 10 posts becomes burnout.

**The AI shift:** You go from creating to directing. AI handles the first draft. You handle strategy and editing.

Result? I post 15x/week and spend 2 hours doing it. Here's how.

---

### **Prompt 3: The Hook Generator**

```
Topic: [what you want to talk about]
Audience: [who you're speaking to]
Goal: [educate/inspire/sell]

Write 10 hooks using:
1. Specific number + outcome
2. Contrarian take
3. Mistake-based
4. Before/after
5. Question + payoff

Make them punchy and curiosity-driven.
```

**What it unlocks:** You never stare at a blank screen again. Generate 10 options in 30 seconds. Pick the best 2.

---

### **Prompt 4: The Carousel Outliner**

```
Topic: [your idea]
Audience: [who this is for]
Key takeaway: [main point]

Create a 7-slide carousel:
- Slide 1: Hook
- Slides 2-5: Core content (one idea per slide, <20 words)
- Slide 6: Proof or example
- Slide 7: CTA

Short sentences. No fluff.
```

**What it unlocks:** Carousels get 3x the engagement of text posts. One idea becomes visual. Paste into Canva. Post.

---

### **Prompt 5: The Video Script Generator**

```
Topic: [your idea]
Hook: [opening line]
Length: [30/60/90 seconds]

Write a video script:
- 0:00-0:03: HOOK (scroll-stopper)
- Next 10-20 sec: Problem/tension
- Next 20-40 sec: Solution/insight
- Final 5-10 sec: CTA

Format: [VISUAL CUE] Voiceover text
Fast-paced. Conversational.
```

**What it unlocks:** Short-form video is the fastest growth lever right now. TikTok, Reels, Shorts â€” same script, different platform.

---

### **Prompt 6: The Voice Calibration Prompt**

```
Here are 5 posts I've written that sound like ME:
[Paste 5 samples]

Analyze my style:
1. Sentence structure
2. Vocabulary choices
3. Tone
4. Rhythm
5. Unique quirks

Give me a "voice profile" I can paste into future prompts.
```

**What it unlocks:** AI stops sounding generic. It writes like YOU. Run this once. Paste the profile into every future prompt.

---

**Why this comes next:** You have positioning. Now you have volume. But posting 15x/week on one platform won't scale. That's where distribution comes in.
sections.callout_text: ðŸ”¥ **The Shift:** Most people use AI to write faster. You're using it to create in YOUR voice at 10x the volume.
sections.takeaway: Content at scale doesn't mean working more. It means directing AI to create volume in your voice.

sections.title: ðŸš€ Layer 3: Distribution (Where It Compounds)
sections.story_beat: Now multiply everything. One idea becomes 6 pieces. This is where reach compounds.
sections.content:
You have positioning. You have content. Now you need reach.

Here's the leverage point: **one idea, six platforms.**

Most people create new content for every platform. That's 10 hours a week minimum.

I create once. Repurpose six times. That's 2 hours.

---

### **Prompt 7: The Multi-Platform Repurposing Engine**

```
Original content:
[Paste your post/script/video transcript]

Repurpose into:
1. LinkedIn post (150-200 words, professional)
2. Twitter thread (8-10 tweets, punchy)
3. Instagram caption (100-150 words, casual)
4. Email section (200-250 words, conversational)
5. YouTube Short script (30-45 sec)
6. Carousel outline (7 slides, <15 words/slide)

Adapt tone and format. Keep the core insight the same.
```

**What it unlocks:** One TikTok becomes a LinkedIn post, Twitter thread, YouTube Short, email, and carousel. That's 6x the reach from the same effort.

---

### **Prompt 8: The Weekly Content Calendar Generator**

```
My content pillars:
1. [Pillar 1]
2. [Pillar 2]
3. [Pillar 3]

Posting schedule:
- [Platform 1]: [X posts/week]
- [Platform 2]: [X posts/week]

Generate a 7-day calendar with:
- Day
- Platform
- Pillar (rotate)
- Post idea (specific)
- Hook (first line)

Format as a table.
```

**What it unlocks:** You batch-create a week of content in one sitting. You're always 7 days ahead. No scrambling.

---

**Why this is the final layer:** You've got positioning (Layer 1). You've got content volume (Layer 2). Now you've got compounding reach (Layer 3). This is the full system.
sections.callout_text: ðŸ’¡ **The Compounding Effect:** Create once, distribute six times. Same effort. 6x the reach. That's how 0 becomes 110K.
sections.takeaway: Distribution multiplies everything. One idea becomes six posts. That's how you scale reach without scaling hours.

sections.title: â±ï¸ The 7-Day Quick Start
sections.story_beat: Tactical roadmap â€” remove friction, make it actionable immediately
sections.content:
You have the system. Now here's exactly what to do in the next 7 days.

---

**Day 1: Find Your Positioning (60 min)**  
Run Prompts 1-2. Pick your angle. Update your bio everywhere. If someone reads it and says "Oh, that's specific," you nailed it.

**Day 2: Build Content Pillars (45 min)**  
Identify 3 themes you can talk about forever. Generate 5 content ideas per pillar. You now have 15 ideas ready to go.

**Day 3: Create Your First 3 Posts (90 min)**  
Use Prompt 3 (hooks) + Prompt 4 or 5 (carousel/video). Run Prompt 6 to calibrate your voice. Edit the outputs. You now have 3 posts that sound like YOU.

**Day 4: Repurpose Into 6 Formats (60 min)**  
Take your best post. Run Prompt 7 (repurposing). Lightly edit. You now have a week of content from 1 idea.

**Day 5: Schedule Everything (30 min)**  
Pick 2-3 platforms. Use Buffer, Hypefury, or Later. Schedule your content for the next 7 days. You're now 7 days ahead.

**Day 6: Engage (45 min)**  
Find 10 accounts in your niche. Comment on their posts. Reply to comments on YOUR posts. Spend 15 minutes. Set a timer.

**Day 7: Plan Next Week (30 min)**  
Run Prompt 8 (content calendar). Batch-create next week's content. You're now 2 weeks ahead. This is the leverage point.

---

**After 7 days you'll have:**  
âœ… Clear positioning that differentiates you  
âœ… A content system that runs on 2-3 hours/week instead of 10+  
âœ… Multi-platform distribution that compounds reach  
âœ… Inbound leads from people who already see you as the authority

---

**Real result:** Aris G. (community member) used this system. Sold $4,750 in one call. Why? The lead already saw him as the authority before the call even started.
